text: @xSayPleasex Oh yeah, guess I did. Didn't own it though, and mostly played battle mode at a friend's house.
author: Sephiko

text: I rented this game once and wasn't too impressed by it. I thought the soundtrack was mostly forgettable, but listening to it almost 20 years later, I immediately remembered this catchy theme. It's interesting to note that this is the only SNES game that used the most advanced DSP chip (DSP-4). From Wikipedia : "Due to the capabilities of the new chip DSP-4 used for this game, it was the first game in the series that was possible to split the track in two different directions with different lengths, sometimes intentionally making one route much faster than the other.".
author: SupraDarky
